Select one of the following statements that is NOT CORRECT:

options.label: B
options.text: Albumin bound bilirubin is transported to the liver.

options.label: C
options.text: High levels of bilirubin can cause damage to the brains of newborn infants.

options.label: D
options.text: Bilirubin contains methyl and vinyl groups.

questions.correct_answer: A. Bilirubin is a cyclic tetrapyrrole.

questions.text: Select the one of the following statements that is NOT CORRECT:

options.label: A
options.text: Wilson disease can be treated using copper chelators such as penicillamine.

options.label: B
options.text: Wilson disease is characterized by copper toxicosis (abnormally high levels of copper).

options.label: C
options.text: Wilson disease is caused by mutation in the gene encoding ceruloplasmin.

questions.correct_answer: C. Wilson disease is caused by mutation in the gene encoding ceruloplasmin.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about the step in glycolysis catalyzed by hexokinase and in gluconeogenesis by glucose 6-phosphotase is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Because hexokinase has a low Km its activity in liver increases as the concentration of glucose in the portal blood increases.

options.label: B
options.text: Glucose 6-phosphatase is mainly active in muscle in the fasting state.

options.label: C
options.text: In hexokinase and glucose 6-phosphotase are both equally active at the same time there is net formation of ATP from ADP and phosphate.

options.label: D
options.text: Liver contains an isoenzyme of hexokinase, glucokinase, which is especially important in the fed state.

questions.correct_answer: D. Liver contains an isoenzyme of hexokinase, glucokinase, which is especially important in the fed state.

options.label: C
options.text: Mechanical ventilation with low tidal volumes and positive end-expiratory pressure

questions.correct_answer: C. Mechanical ventilation with low tidal volumes and positive end-expiratory pressure

questions.text: A 50 -year-old man presented with fever, cough, sputum, right-sided pleuritic chest pain and dyspnea. Chest x-ray reveals a consolidation right lower zone and CBC shows an elevated neutrophil count. Which feature would most strongly support inpatient admission for management?

options.label: D

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman c/o dyspnea for 4 months. On physical examination lungs are clear, P2 is loud, large V waves in JVP. Chest x-ray shows enlargement of the central pulmonary arteries. What is the confirmatory investigation in establishing a diagnosis in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Spirometry with measurement of diffusing capacity of carbon monoxide

questions.text: A 20-year-old woman presents with bilateral conductive deafness, palpable purpura on the legs and hemoptysis. Radiograph of the chest shows a cavity in left lower zone. Investigations reveal total leukocyte count 12000/mm, red cell casts in the urine and 12,000/mm3 serum creatinine 3 mg/dL. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 45-year-old female is a known type 2 diabetes patient on metformin. Medical records shows that her blood pressure was greater than 140/90 mm Hg at her last two clinic visits. Her blood pressure today is 150/90.What is the best next step in her blood pressure management?

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: A 42-year-old woman with mitral valve prolapse

options.label: D
options.text: A 65-year-old man with prosthetic aortic valve

questions.correct_answer: D. A 65-year-old man with prosthetic aortic valve

questions.text: A patient is diagnosed to have maturity onset diabetes of young (MODY) due to mutation in glucokinase. What will be the management plan of this patient?

A 40-year-old male patient complains of fever and shortness of breath. There is no pleuritic chest pain or rigors and no sputum production. A chest x-ray shows diffuse perihilar infiltrates as shown in figure. The patient’s condition worsens while on levofloxacin. A methenamine silver stain of bronchial washings shows cyst-like structures. Which of the following is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Definitive diagnosis can be made by serology.

options.label: B
options.text: Bronchoalveolar lavage culture will grow this organism after 3 days.

options.label: C
options.text: History will likely provide important clues to the diagnosis.

options.label: D
options.text: Cavitary disease is likely to develop.

questions.correct_answer: C. History will likely provide important clues to the diagnosis.

questions.text: A 22-year-old man develops the insidious onset of low back pain improved with exercise and worsened by rest. There is no history of diarrhea, conjunctivitis, urethritis, rash, or nail changes. On examination, the patient has loss of mobility with respect to lumbar flexion and extension. He has a kyphotic posture. Which test or group of tests would be most supportive of suspected diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: ESR, HLA-B27 and plain X ray of the sacroiliac joints

options.label: C
options.text: Rheumatoid factor, anti-CCP, and C-reactive protein level.

questions.correct_answer: B. ESR, HLA-B27 and plain X ray of the sacroiliac joints

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman has pain in her fingers on exposure to cold, arthralgias, and difficulty swallowing solid food. On examination thickening of the skin over the hands, arms, and trunk is present. What is the best diagnostic workup?

options.label: C
options.text: Creatine kinase (CK) and ant synthetase antibodies (such as anti-Jo-1)

questions.correct_answer: B. Antinuclear, anti-Scl-70, and anticentromere antibodies

questions.text: A 50-year-old Female presented with proximal lower limb weakness for 6 weeks with purplish rash that involves both eyelids. The patient experiences pain while getting up from squatting position. Extra-ocular muscles and other Neurological examination is normal. There is no significant past medical history. What is the best next diagnostic test?
Bleeding time is not usually prolonged in:

A 56 year old is a known case of alcoholic cirrhosis on treatment. Patient was diagnosed with cirrhosis when he developed jaundice and ascites 2 years back. He is on treatment with furosemide and spironolactone. There is no pedal edema or ascites at present. However, he complaints of dyspnea in the upright position with relief in the supine position. This symptom will be best described as

A 28-yr-old boy presents with digital gangrene for last 4 weeks. On examination the blood pressure is 170/110 mm of Hg and all peripheral pulses were palpable. He gives history of Raynaud’s phenomenon and episodes of Hematuria. He has no fever, cough or hemoptysis. The Renal function test is normal with no dysmorphic RBC or cast in the urine. Antinuclear antibodies, antibody to double stranded DNA and anti-neutrophil cytoplasmic antibody were negative. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 40-year-old patient presents with an excruciating headache. It is ill-localised and is explosive pain which begins without warning, reaches it's peak within 5 minutes and lasts for 45 minutes and commonly awakens the patient from sleep. It is associated with homolateral lacrimation and reddening of eye and ptosis and nasal stuffiness. Which of the following statements about the diagnosis is FALSE

options.label: B
options.text: Onset typically in 30-50 years of life

options.label: D
options.text: High flow oxygen can abort an attack.

questions.text: An 8-year child presents with abdominal pain. The pain is located to the right hypochondrium. The pain is colicky and disappears after few minutes. An ultrasound shows gall stones, and a shrunken spleen. Rest of physical examination is normal. A peripheral blood examination showed abnormal shaped RBC and you start suspecting a genetic disease. Which of the following is true about this child?
A 50-year-old woman with type 2 diabetes and hypertension undergoes renal biopsy for evaluation of chronic renal disease. The biopsy is shown in the image. What is the appropriate diagnosis?

This photograph shows a high power view of an ovarian tumor from a 30 year old woman who presented with abnormal uterine bleeding and abdominal pain. Neoplastic cells were immunoreactive for inhibin. Which of the following is the diagnosis?

A 48-year-old male presents recurrent infections, jaundice and bloated abdomen. Clinical examination shows hepatosplenomegaly and ascites. An USG shows a thrombus is the hepatic vein, the liver is edematous. A blood examination shows HCT 52%, Hb 18.5g/dL, TLC 3000, platelet count 1.2L. which of the following investigations will not help in arriving at diagnosis of this patient?

A 35-year male has been passing frequent dark coloured urine for last one month. Such episodes occur at any time during the day without any time preference. Since then he has developed easy fatigueability and yellowish discolouration of sclera and skin. Now he has difficulty in moving his left upper limb. A CT brain shows a thrombus. Abdominal examination shows no organomegaly. A hemogram done shows Hb 8g%, MCV 70 MCH 25 peripheral blood smear showed microcytic hypochromic anemia platelet count of 55000/cu.mm. Serum ferritin is 20µg/l, Serum iron is 30µg/dl and TIBC is 350µg/dl. Urine examination confirms presence of haemoglobin. Which of the following investigation would most likely help to arrive at diagnosis?

A 36-year-old woman has urinary frequency with dysuria for the past 4 days. On physical examination she has no flank pain or tenderness. A urinalysis reveals sp. gr. 1.014, pH 7.5, no glucose, no protein, no blood, nitrite positive, and many WBC's. She has a serum creatinine of 0.9 mg/dL. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 22-year old soccer player suddenly collapses on the field during a practice match. He died on the way to hospital. The autopsy finding of heart is as shown in the figure. Which of the following mutation can be seen in this patient?

A 46 year old chronic smoker presents with cough, intermittent fever for many weeks. Now he also complains of recent onset of hoarseness of voice, cough. He has lost 6 kg after the onset of the symptoms. On chest X ray showed calcified lung lesion with few hilar lymphadenopathy. Serum calcium levels are increased. A biopsy from the lung is as below what is the likely treatment?

A 43 year old presents with abdominal pain, nausea vomiting diarrrhea and weightloss of 6 kg in the past 4 weeks. The HLA B 27 male has been receiving therapy for his poly arthropathy for last 5 years which is partially under control. A biopsy from intestine was done and is as shown in the image. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 53-year-old presents with easy fatigue, repeated sinopulmonary infections for last few months. Clinical examination shows spleen is enlarged and no lymphnodes are palpable. CBC shows Hb9g/dL, TLC 3000/cu.mm, platelet count 39,000/cu.mm Peripheral blood smear was done and is as shown in the image. Which of the following is true about this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: All transretinoic acid is treatment for this disease

options.label: B
options.text: This patient is having an aplastic anemia

options.label: C
options.text: This patient is having a peripheral B cell neoplasm

options.label: D
options.text: Bortezomib is one of the drugs to be included in treatment of this case

questions.correct_answer: C. This patient is having a peripheral B cell neoplasm

questions.text: A medical student is describing histology of an anaplastic carcinoma of thyroid, which of the following histological feature is not applicable for features of anaplasia in this patient?

A 53-year-old chronic smoker presents with 10kg weight loss in last 4 weeks, he complains of reduced appetite and physically appears to be wasted. A CT lung showed a mass in the periphery of the lung. Which of the following mechanism best explains the manifestation in this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Metastasis to hunger centre in brain

options.label: D
options.text: Reduced volume of stomach due to local effects

questions.text: The function and mechanism of action of thrombomodulin in normal hemostasis is?

A 15-year-old healthy girl with no major medical problems notes blotchy areas of erythema that are pruritic over the skin of her arms, legs, and trunk within an hour every time she eats seafood, followed by diarrhea. These problems abate within 3 hours, and then physical examination reveals no abnormal findings. Which of the following immunologic abnormalities is she most likely to have?

A 62-year-old man has had back pain for the past 8 months. He has had a productive cough for the past 2 days. On physical examination his temperature is 39°C and there is dullness to percussion at the right lung base. A chest radiograph shows right lower lobe consolidation. An abdominal CT scan shows multiple lytic lesions of the vertebrae. On the day prior to death his serum urea nitrogen was 63 mg/dL with creatinine 7.1 mg/dL. A dipstick urinalysis was normal. At autopsy, his kidneys are firm and pale. Microscopically, there is abundant pink hyaline material in glomeruli and around small vessels.

A 4-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department because of fever, nausea, and headache and a rash as shown in the image for 1day duration. His temperature is 39.7°C . Examination shows involuntary flexion of the knees and hips when the neck is flexed. A lumbar puncture is performed and cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) analysis shows numerous segmented neutrophils and a decreased glucose concentration. Gram stain of the CSF shows This patient is at increased risk for which of the following complications?

An investigator studying patients with symptoms of arthritis detects a nonenveloped virus with a single-stranded DNA genome in the serum of a pregnant patient. Fetal infection with this pathogen is most likely to cause which of the following manifestations?

A 48-year-old woman comes to the physician because of a 7-day history of progressively worsening shortness of breath. She has a history of asthma and has frequent exacerbations despite receiving maximal medical care. Physical examination shows scattered expiratory wheezing. Laboratory studies show a leukocyte count of 9,800/mm3 (13% eosinophils) and elevated serum concentration of immunoglobulin E. An x-ray of the chest thickened bronchial walls and perihilar opacities. Sputum culture revealed the pathogen as shown in the image. Which of the following is most likely to be increased in this patient?

A previously healthy 25-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 4-day history of fever, joint and I pain, diffuse headache, and pain behind the eyes. This morning he noticed that his gums bled when he brushed his teeth. He returned from a backpacking trip to the Philippines 4 days ago. His temperature is 39.4°C .Physical examination shows a diffuse maculopapular rash. His leukocyte count is 3,200/mm3 and platelet count 89,000/mm3. Further evaluation shows increased serum levels of a flavivirus. Which of the following is the most likely causal pathogen?

A 32-year-old NRI man is brought to the physician by his wife for a 3-day history of fever, headaches, and myalgia. He returned from a camping trip in Oklahoma 10 days ago. He works as a computer salesman. His temperature 38.1°C . Neurologic examination shows a sustained clonus of the right ankle. He is disoriented to place and time but recognizes his wife. Laboratory studies show a leukocyte count of 1,700/mm3 and a platelet count of 46,000/mm3. A peripheral blood smear shows monocytes with intracytoplasmic morulae as shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely causal organism?

A 22-year-old man comes to the physician because of abdominal pain, diarrhea, and weight loss that started one week before. He is from rural village and had a practice of open defecation. He does not smoke or drink alcohol. Stool microscopy shows rhabditiform larvae This patient is most likely to develop which of the following?

A male newborn is delivered at term to a 28-year-old primigravid woman from a rural village. Birth weight is 3 kgs. His mother had no routine prenatal care. She reports that the pregnancy was uncomplicated apart from a 2-week episode of a low-grade fever and swollen lymph nodes during her early pregnancy. She has avoided all routine vaccinations because she believes that “natural immunity is better." The newborn is at the 35th percentile for height, 15th percentile for weight, and 3rd percentile for head circumference. Fundoscopic examination shows inflammation of the choroid and the retina in both eyes. A CT scan of the head shows diffuse intracranial calcifications and mild ventriculomegaly. Prenatal avoidance of which of the following would have most likely prevented this newborn’s condition?

A 62-year-old woman with metastatic breast cancer comes to the physician because of a 2-day history of fever, chills, and new gluteal lesions. The lesions began as painless red macules and evolved into painful ulcers overnight. She received her fourth course of palliative chemotherapy 2 weeks ago. Laboratory studies show a leukocyte count of 2,000/mm3 (20% segmented neutrophils). A photograph of one of the skin lesions is shown here. Which of the following virulence factors is most likely involved in the pathogenesis of this patient's skin finding?

A 44-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 3-week history of productive cough, fever, and lethargy. He also has several skin lesions over his body. His symptoms began 3 weeks after his camping trip in Mizoram. Three years ago, he underwent kidney transplantation for polycystic kidney disease. Current medications includes prednisone. His temperature is 38°C . Diffuse crackles are heard over the lung fields. There are 4 white, verrucous skin patches over his chest and upper limbs. A photomicrograph of a skin biopsy specimen from one of the lesions is shown. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient admitted with cough with expectoration. Sputum examination by Auramine phenol staining shown in the image. Choose the correct pair of microscope and the resolution power.
Which of the following classes of medications are effective for chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyps, as demonstrated by multiple randomized placebo-controlled trials?

A 38-year-old woman presents with olfactory loss of one-month duration after a severe upper respiratory tract infection. She is particularly disturbed by a constant foul odor seemingly occurring from the right side. Which of the following would you advise the patient to do?

options.label: A
options.text: To undergo a craniotomy and resection of the olfactory bulbs to completely eliminate the foul smell

options.label: B
options.text: To start gabapentin to decrease the severity of the smell

options.label: C
options.text: To use saline drops and wait for the smell to diminish over time

options.label: D
options.text: To undergo endoscopic resection of the right olfactory epithelium

questions.correct_answer: C. To use saline drops and wait for the smell to diminish over time

questions.text: Tympanosclerosis (as shown in the given image) is a common clinico-pathological entity of the middle ear cleft. The commonest site of intratympanic tympanosclerosis is
Along with the middle turbinate and middle meatus, what is the most common site of origin of inverting papilloma?

A 5-year-old child presented to the emergency department (ED) with acutely worsened respiratory status with high grade fever. She was previously well and had no significant past medical history. Earlier that day she developed a sore throat with rapidly worsening dysphagia, with inability to tolerate her secretions upon presentation to the emergency. She reported difficulty breathing that was markedly worse when she tried to lie flat. She denied any recent trauma.She had no prior surgical history. She took no medications but had a penicillin allergy. Her parents reported she had only received some of her childhood vaccines. This patient was sitting in the “tripod” position,erect and leaning slightly forward, which uses gravity to aid in reduction of the supraglottic obstruction. A muffled or “hot potato” voice and tenderness to direct palpation over the larynx are also present. Which is the first priority when epiglottitis is suspected?
Which of following have been used as medical treatments in management of juvenile nasopharyngeal angiofibroma (JNA)?
Which two ossification centers give rise to the tegmen tympani and tegmen mastoideum?
What portion of the facial nerve is involved in the pathophysiology of Bell’s palsy?
The following are treatments for Meniere’s disease that are considered destructive except
Which of the following would not be an expected location for a labyrinthine fistula in a patient with chronic ear disease and recurrent cholesteatoma?
A preterm, 28wks, 1000gms, has respiratory distress. There is see-saw breathing, marked lower chest retractions and xiphoid retractions, with audible grunting, marked flaring. Silverman score is
What is the best approach for managing a 28 wks baby, 800gms in delivery room?
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ • In the past administration of surfactant into the trachea of symptomatic premature infants immediately after birth (prophylactic) or during the 1st few hr of life (early rescue) showed reduced air leak and mortality from RDS.
  • ↳ • CPAP started at birth is as effective as prophylactic or early surfactant and is the approach of choice for the delivery room management of a preterm neonate at risk for RDS.
  • ↳ • Early use of CPAP for stabilization of at-risk preterm infants beginning as early as in the delivery room reduces ventilatory needs.

questions.text: According to NRP 2021, target spO2 at 3 minutes of life is
Which anomaly occurs 200 times more commonly in infants of DM mothers as compared to normal population?

What is the inheritance of Pearson syndrome?
What does the third line from below depict?

options.label: D
options.text: Post natal onset of short stature

questions.text: Severe acute malnutrition is defined by a
questions.correct_answer: B. below -3z scores weight for height

questions.text: Which statement about ductus arteriosus is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: The normal ductus arteriosus differs morphologically from the adjoining aorta and pulmonary artery in that the ductus has a significant amount of circularly arranged smooth muscle in its medial layer.

options.label: B
options.text: During fetal life, patency of the ductus arteriosus appears to be maintained by the combined relaxant effects of low oxygen tension and endogenously produced prostaglandins, specifically prostaglandin E2.

options.label: C
options.text: In a full-term neonate, oxygen is the most important factor controlling ductal closure.

options.label: D
options.text: When the Po2 of the blood passing through the ductus reaches about 50 mm Hg, the ductal wall remains patent.

questions.correct_answer: D. When the Po2 of the blood passing through the ductus reaches about 50 mm Hg, the ductal wall remains patent.
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ • When the Po2 of the blood passing through the ductus reaches about 50 mm Hg, the ductal wall begins to constrict.
  • ↳ • Functional closure of the ductus arteriosus is usually complete by 10-15 hr in a normal neonate, although the ductus may remain patent much longer in the presence of congenital heart disease, especially when associated with cyanosis.

An infant girl is born 4 weeks prematurely and manifests jaundice, an intractable rash, persistent rhinitis, pneumonia, anemia, generalized lymphadenopathy with bony radiological abnormalities. Which one of the following findings would least likely be present on ophthalmic examination of this newborn child?
Which structure and its bony framework is paired incorrectly?

options.label: A
options.text: Lacrimal sac fossa—lacrimal and maxillary bones

options.label: B
options.text: Optic canal—greater wing of the sphenoid bone

options.label: C
options.text: Superior orbital fissure— greater and lesser wing of the sphenoid bone

questions.correct_answer: B. Optic canal—greater wing of the sphenoid bone

questions.text: Laser trabeculoplasty is most likely to be helpful in an eye with which one of the following types of uncontrolled glaucoma?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The sign is seen in early stages of Diabetic retinopathy

options.label: C
options.text: Histologically, there is loss of pericytes around the capillaries

questions.text: Which of the following conditions can have this sign?
What is the cause for posterior capsular opacification following cataract surgery and implantation of an IOL?

options.label: A
options.text: Fibrovascular ingrowth stimulated by the lens

questions.correct_answer: C. Proliferation of residual lens epithelium

questions.text: Which of the following is not a feature of nuclear 3rd nerve palsy
False statement about follicular thyroid cancer?

options.label: A
options.text: Multinodular goitre is a risk factor

options.label: D
options.text: Blood bone secondaries to skull is common

questions.text: Treatment of papillary cancer on < 1cm in < 40 years old patient is?

A 25 years old male sustained a sharp injury in right groin, which bled in pulsatile fashion. After 15 mins in emergency room his bleeding has stopped with pressure dressing but at right groin there is an expanding hematoma. Further management of this patient should be?

options.label: C
options.text: Admission for close observation and monitoring.

questions.text: A patient presented with fracture ribs with hemothorax and hypotension. ICD was done and about 300 ml of blood was drained. Later on collection in ICD bag is at the rate of 20 ml / hrs for next 3 hours. After 1.5 liters of fluid administration his BP is still 96/60 mm of Hg and CVP is 6. Abdomen is soft and nontender. His hypovolemia is best managed by?
Which of the following criteria is not included in superficial surgical site infection?

options.label: B
options.text: Organisms isolated from an aseptically obtained culture of fluid or tissue from the incision

options.label: C
options.text: At least one of the following signs or symptoms of infection - pain or tenderness, localised swelling, redness or heat - and the incision is deliberately opened by a surgeon, unless the culture is negative

options.label: D
options.text: Stitch abscesses (minimal inflammation and discharge confined to the points of suture penetration)

questions.correct_answer: D. Stitch abscesses (minimal inflammation and discharge confined to the points of suture penetration)

questions.text: All are features of remodelling phase of wound healing except?

A 47-years-old male repairman was working on the central air conditioning system of a shopping mall when his hand was hit with high-pressure gas while opening one of the lines. Most of his forearm was exposed to the high-pressure gas. Pain has worsened with time and became severe on his way to the hospital. He also complains about burning sensation and muscle spasm in his arm and hand. On physical Local examination chemical burns was seen. Which of the following would be the initial treatment?

options.label: B
options.text: Prompt 10 percent copper sulfate irrigation mixed with sterile water

options.label: C
options.text: Prompt water irrigation followed by topical application of 2.5 percent calcium gluconate gel

questions.correct_answer: C. Prompt water irrigation followed by topical application of 2.5 percent calcium gluconate gel

A 66-year-old male patient is seen for a complaint of intermittent decrease in faecal calibre. He denied significant weight loss during the last six months. His family history is remarkable for uterine adenocarcinoma in his elder sister, who died for the same reason at age 48. He was scheduled for a colonoscopy, which revealed a pedunculated 1 cm polyp in splenic flexure. The pathologic evaluation was conclusive for adenocarcinoma at the tip of the polyp. The stalk and the base are not involved. What is the next step in the management of this patient?

Andy Gump deformity is seen after resection of?

A 40 years old male with RTA was brought to emergency with GCS 12 and H/O vomiting. CT scan showed a biconvex hyper intense shadow in right temporal area with a overlying fracture and 1.5 cm midline shift. He should be managed by?

options.label: A
options.text: IV fluids and anticonvulsants but no mannitol (For the fear of rebound edema).

options.label: B
options.text: IV fluids and anticonvulsants with mannitol (due to raised ICP suggested by Vomiting).

options.label: C
options.text: IV fluids and anticonvulsants with Intubation (to induce hypercarbia and reduce ICP)

questions.text: A 29 years old G 2 P 1 L 1 with 36 weeks pregnancy underwent GBS screening. Which of the following is not true regarding it?

questions.correct_answer: A. If screening is positive then give immediate treatment by antibiotics
